conclusion: Need to analyze the graph showing reciprocal of velocity as a function of displacement.
The graph plots 1/v on the y-axis and x on the x-axis; it is a straight line with a positive slope.
A positive slope indicates that as x increases, 1/v also increases.
Since 1/v is increasing, v must be decreasing because the reciprocal of a decreasing number increases.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
If velocity is decreasing, acceleration is negative, indicating deceleration.
The positive slope of 1/v versus x implies that velocity is decreasing with displacement.
